Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ughh... Blech.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, where does it hurt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just... all over. I don't want to do anything... I'm dying...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, that's not how it works. You have to point to a specific part of the body.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right there. [Michael points to computer screen.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [reading from screen] "Abdomen. Menses."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "The uterus contracts after your egg passes through it."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not it. I don't have eggs.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: About 40 times a year, Michael gets really sick, but has no symptoms. Dwight is always gravely concerned.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, is it possible you ate food that contained animal waste?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's possible.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: David Wallace is on line one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The CFO? Ohh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, everybody out. Out. Out. Out. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: To what do I owe this great honor, David Wallace?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [on phone] Michael, I am calling--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And Gromit. [David sighs] Jan? Is Jan there?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jan is out of town right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you sigh like Jan. I broke Jan's heart, David, and it was awful. It was... It was never my intention to ruin a life. But you know what? Sometimes...

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...you just gots to get your freak on.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I am calling to see if you can come down and interview for a job we have opening in corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Week from today. Bring your first quarter stats and your recommendation for who would take over the Scranton Branch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. I wish I had prepared something to say.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: That's not necessary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: May God guide you in your quest.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, everybody have their towels and swim suits? We have about an hour and half. I suggest that you all go potty now and then we will be congregating on the partay bus.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh I'm excited. Today is Beach Day! And Michael is taking the whole office to the beach. So I'm wearing my bathing suit underneath my shirt [lifts up shirt, definitely not wearing anything underneath] Oh, yeah... I packed it in my purse.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, you brought your Speedo, I assume?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't wear a Speedo, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you can't swim in leather pants. [laughs] I'm just yankin' your chain. Not literally.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Anybody need sun block? Got SPF 30.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what? Uh, you're not going.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's Beach Day...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know. I'm sorry, Toby. We... um... Somebody has to stay here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want today to be a beautiful memory... that the staff and I share after I have passed on to New York. And if Toby is a part of it... then it'll suck.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, want my sun screen?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, great. I forgot mine and I'm wearing a two piece.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Pam, I have a very important job for you

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought we were just having fun at the beach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are. We are. But, I would like you to take notes. And I want you to find out about people's character. Not their hotness, per se, but their humor, and their charisma, and the indefinable quality that makes you all glad to follow me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What happens to a company if somebody takes their boss away? I will answer your question with a question. It's like what happens to a chicken when you take its head away. It dies. Unless you find a new head. I need to see which one of these people have the skills to be a chicken head.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You want me to write down people's indefinable qualities?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to write down everything that people are doing all day. And then type it up, in a way that is helpful. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have the most boring job in the office, so... why wouldn't I have the most boring job on beach day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This way to the partay bus.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I just want to lie on the beach and eat hot dogs. That's all I've ever wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] [Angela mouthing the words next to him] And the night got deathly quiet, and his face lost all expression. Said, "If you're gonna play the game, boy, ya gotta learn to play it right." [rest of office joins in at varying times] You got to know when to hold 'em, know when to fold 'em, Know when to walk away and know when to run. You never count your money when you're sittin' at the table. There'll be time enough for countin' when the dealin's done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody, may I have you attention please? Today, we are not just spending a day at the beach.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, sweet mother of God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you don't like it, Stanley, you can go to the back of the bus.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or the front of the bus. Or drive the bus. Just, we are all participating in mandatory fun activities. Funtivities! And there is a special secret prize for the winner!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! Funtivities! I knew it wasn't just a trip to the beach.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what? Your enthusiasm's turning people off.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hope there will be management parables.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, [whispering] Hey Pam, did you get that down?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like everything I said and everything they did and... Just don't...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well... no, I don't... exactly... what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well write it down before you forget it. That's... You've just been drawing pictures. [sighs] Rrrr. I can't stay mad at you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we are ladies and gentlemen. Everybody ready? Last one down is a rotten egg. [Gets off bus] Watch out for snakes!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Everyone put on sunscreen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, find a cozy spot. Everybody settle in. [everybody sits down on beach] OK, everybody up! Circle 'round. [motions for circle to form] Let us play some games. We are situated on the northeast corner of scenic Lake Scranton. America's eighth largest indigenous body of water. It is here that a group of Americans will undergo the ultimate challenge. One day, 14 strangers who work together, but only one survivor.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just words. Inspiring words. [under breath] Not a contender. [out loud] For the competitions, you will be divided into four tribes. Each tribe will have a leader that I will pick randomly off the top of my head without thinking. Jim, Dwight, Andy and Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Choose your tribes. Except for Pam. Not Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim Halpert. Pros: smart, cool, good-looking. Remind you of anybody you know? Cons: not a hard worker. I can spend all day on a project, and he will finish the same project in a half an hour. So that should tell you something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I choose Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not playing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, temp.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight is an obvious candidate for my job. He has the best sales record in the office. He loves the work. He is, however, an idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are going to choose team names. Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We will be called Gryffindor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Not Slytherin?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Slytherin are the bad guys, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. Okay, we will be Voldemort.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He-who-must-not-be-named? I wouldn't do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [starts chanting] Vol-de-mort, Vol-de-mort ...[Kevin and Karen follow] Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort! Vol-de-mort!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, seriously. You really shouldn't be saying that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. Ok, Ok... Stanley, your team name?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't care what you call my team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Then I will name your team the Red team.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No [crosses arms], the blue team.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am also considering Stanley because of all the good that black people have done. For America.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We will be team U.S.A.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very good. Pam, please take a note that Andy is patriotic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard. Pros: He's classy. He gets me. He went to Cornell. I trust him. Cons: I don't really trust him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is time for the great spoon and egg race. This one is with a little twist.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: There's already a twist, you're carrying an egg on a spoon.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh... The person carrying the egg will be blindfolded. Please put on your blindfolds. That person carrying the egg will go down, circle a torch, come back, deposit their egg in the pail. First team back is the winner. Alright. Ready? Set. Go! [contestants start walking]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Come on Phyllis, you can do it. [Phyllis' egg falls off spoon] Ahh...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Thank you so much. [Stanley sits down and pulls out his crossword puzzle]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Phyllis is out. Yes! [to Kelly] Follow my voice. Follow my voice. Yeah, keep it moving. Keep it moving. Right this way. Looking good. [Cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't want to hit the big rock!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't worry. You're not...

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I know I'm near the big rock. I just know it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No where near the big rock.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [takes off blindfold] I just don't want to get hit by it...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What're you doing? No! See, now we're disqualified.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am okay if I lose every single contest today. Honestly. Because I see these contests as an opportunity for me to demonstrate what a good sport I am. Mallard! [throws a stone]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Karen] Woah, stop, stop, stop. There's a hole. Step over the hole.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hole?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup. [Karen takes a big step] Perfect, oooh, just made it. OK, turn left.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Come on! Come on! Andale! Arriba! Arriba!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Can you just stop this right now, or I'm not gonna do this anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you saying?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You have to stop yelling at me or I'm not gonna do the egg race.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, I apologize for yelling at you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's what being a good captain is about. It's about listening to the members of your team.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am trying to bring team spirit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Karen] Woah, stop, another hole. Take a big step. [Karen steps into lake] Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [lifts up blindfold] Oh my God! You ass! [chases Jim and throws egg at him] [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's nothing better than a beautiful day at the beach, filled with sun, surf, and uh... diligent note-taking. [holds up notes]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [off screen] Pam...you're missing things. [shakes off hand and starts writing in notebook]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [at Ryan holding egg in spoon] Let's go! Let's go! Come on! Mush! Mush! Come on you bastard! [Ryan takes off blindfold and throws it to ground along with egg and spoon] What the? Damn it temp!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [begins to clap] Great job everyone, that was fantastic. [Michael sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay Pam, I have another little project for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Does it have to do with these shopping bags filled with hot dogs?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Smart as a whip! Yes! [holds up hot dog packages] These are pre-cooked, so it's not absolutely necessary, but I would appreciate it if you could heat up 800 hot dogs for a little contest I'm going to be having. I would greatly appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When's the contest?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like umm...[looks at watch] ten minutes?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How am I supposed to... get...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks a bunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A good manager has got to be hungry. Hungry for success.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, who's hungry [Kevin starts to put hot dog in mouth] No, no, no. Do not touch the food. Please. Not yet. That is our next event. A hot dog eating contest. [sighs at the table] For those of you who are curious, the world record is 54 and one half hot dogs. Wow! And you know what? I personally have cooked up enough so each and every one of you could break that record. So shoot for the stars, OK? Alright, the team that eats the most hot dogs in ten minutes will be declared the winner. On you mark. Get set.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Can I have a turkey burger?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I have the only one. I claimed it. Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Turkey is a healthy meat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's very good for you. [overlapping talk from all at table]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, guys, guys. Come on! Pleeeeease... Let's just... OK, it's very important that you all try to eat as many hot dogs as you can. On your mark. Get set. Eat!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is there any mustard?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No mustard, no mustard. Just eat it, eat it, Phyllis. Dip it in the water so it'll slide down your gullet more easily.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, the winner gets a big, big prize.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [eating hot dog] What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't say.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can't say, or you can't pronounce it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The winner gets a regional manager's salary for a year, and a Sebring, and the feeling that they are making a difference in the world.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Can we just take those first two things?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The winner of today gets my job. Ok? I'm interviewing for a job at corporate. And they're only interviewing a handful of people and I'm the most qualified and I'll probably get it. Alright?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're leaving?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't want to tell anyway. I didn't want to cast a pall over our fun beach day. But you know what? I don't know who to recommend because frankly nobody is stepping up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [slams fist onto table] I am so hungry! [starts eating hot dog real fast]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do you expect me to believe that you're truly making your recommendations on this basis?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [points at Stanley] Word. [Stanley starts eating hot dog] There we go. Let's see it.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I would rather work for an upturned broom with a bucket for a head than work for somebody else in this office besides myself. Game on!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Four. Three. Two. One. Stop your eating! And the winner is Andy Bernard, with 14 hot dogs!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Team U.S.A.!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One came up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: 13 hot dogs, everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [holding a fish with all the meat stripped off] Nobody told me we were going to have hot dogs!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sabotage.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What? What are you saying? Did you say sandwich?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. I was saying that before. Not now. Now I am saying sabotage. The ancient Dutch art of screwing up your own team.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I knew you were saying sabotage. I was giving you an example of it. I will misunderstand everything that Andy says until he goes insane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If Michael organizes some kind of group hug, stand next to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's very simple. There are only three rules. You must not touch the ground. You must not step outside of the ring. And you must always wear the safety mittens.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Uh, we don't have any safety mittens

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Probably left them in the trunk of my car. It's alright. It's alright. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Get 'em big boy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaaaaand, go!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: C'mon, Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [growly noises, Jim looks terrified]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice, Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [to Jim] Sorry about that. It's all about taking points away from Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. No. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. I have never seen that look in a man's eyes... ever. I thought that I might die. On beach day.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: If either of these guys are put in charge of the office I will transfer to Albany. Gil can come if he wants. I'm kinda looking for a way out of that relationship anyway. I think I might try girls for a while. Angela thinks I can cross over. We'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Andy and Dwight sumo wrestle] Gaaaaa....

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: One. Two. Three.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yaaaaa! Yaaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excellent!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gryffindor! Gryffindor!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't win. But the only reason I didn't win is because I recently learned that it's better to work thing out with words.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's not why you lost.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah it is. I totally could have kicked your butt so bad.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, right.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, right, c'mon! C'mon! [Dwight and Andy wrestle]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [bouncing off of Andy] Aaaagh! Uggggh! How do you like that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Trying to wet bandana, falls in water] Oh, God! Waaa! Guhh! Wuuuh! Help! Angela! Angela, hey! Oh, thank God! Please tell somebody!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What, Andy? Andy, what should I tell them?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Go tell them I'm floating away, obviously!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't understand what you want from me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela, it's pretty simple! Look at what I'm doing and go tell somebody about it!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sorry! Bye, Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I knew that finding a successor would be difficult. I did not know that it would be impossible. Thus far the candidates have been wildly disappointing. Uh, Jim is not taking it seriously. Uh, Stanley is having a stroke. And Andy, where is he? Where the hell is Andy? Where is he, Pam? Do you know? Ah... who's ahead in points?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think they're even. At various times you gave Jim ten points, Dwight a gold star, and Stanley a thumbs up. And I don't really know how to compare those units.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check to see if there is a conversion chart in that notebook.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I really doubt it, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Please just check.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on cell phone] Great. Yeah, I'll see you next week. Thank you, and here is Karen Filipelli. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hello? Yeah, hi David. Yes, I would like to be considered for the corporate position in well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In well?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: As well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How would that work in well? I just want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Yes. uh, huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a minute.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That would be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If this job is in a well, I don't want it.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [whispering] Cut it out!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What does a great manager need most of all? Courage.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How so? I mean... sure thing, that sounds smart... I can't do this anymore! I'm goin' to sit in the bus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your loss, Stanley. Meanwhile the rest of us will have a super fun time defeating our fear and creating a lasting memory. Walking through FIRE!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who among you has the guts to replace me? Let him walk across these coals.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you going to try it?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm not going to talk through the fire after your disgusting feet have gone through.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela, it is a million degrees.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm gonna do it. And I fully expect to burn my feet and go to the hospital. That's the right spirit when doing a coal walk, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, not you, Pam. You have to keep score.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'd like to try it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pointless.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But I'm not kidding. I really want to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blah, blah, blee blup, blup, okay? This is about guts. It takes guts to be a regional manager. Jim, you're up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ji.. why not? C'mon.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, 'cause I don't want my feet to get burned.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You do not have what it takes to be a regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's harsh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's next? Andy? Where's Andy? Andy is never here today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [lying in water, car lights light up his location] Hello? Who's there? My name is Andrew Bernard, I was with a group called Dunder Mifflin. Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why don't you go Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I already did. Remember? I burned my foot on a George Foreman grill.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that is not the same at all. If you're going to ask other people to do it, you should do it yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Okay. Alright. Fine. 'kay. [clears throat, breathes noisily] The mind has to wrap around the foot. [exhales] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you want us to count to three?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Count to three, please.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Three. Two. One.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Count the other way. Count... no, no, count one, two, three, not three, two, one.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: One. Two. Three! Go! Do it! Go, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait! Am I going on go? Or am I going on three?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: On the go that's after three.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: One, two, three, go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! It's okay. I will do this Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't, don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walking on coals] I will walk and stand on these coals until you award me the position of regional manager!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Wow. Go, Dwight. Keep moving.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [standing still, on the coals] GIVE ME THE JOB! GIVE ME THE JOB!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going to give it to you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [falling on his knees, then on all fours] Aaagh, aaagh!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: [yelling excitedly for Dwight to get off the coals]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, do something!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aggggh, that stings!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Being the boss is also about image. I've never looked like that. That was gross. I just, I don't see the connection between a firewalk and management. Worst seventy-five bucks I ever spent. You know what, if I had to pick my replacement based on today, it would be Mr. "Outside Hire."

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Or Mrs. "Outside Hire."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Ummm, hmm... True. Look, I don't want to leave this branch that I love to an outside hire therefore we are going to have a one hundred point winner take all sudden death tribal council round. To test the aspect of my job that I think is the most important, something I call the Bob Hope factor.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Who's Bob Hope?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: God! He's a comedian.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, like Amanda Bynes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's Amanda Bynes?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She's from "What a Girl Wants."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I love that movie. Yes, Kelly is right, the person to replace me has to have a great sense of humor and they have to possess the leadership qualities of a Bynes or a Hope. So without further ado, Jim and Dwight show us what you got.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, I know what you're looking for, but um, I got to be honest, I really don't think I should be considered as your replacement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are being too modest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, on Thursday I'm going to drive down and interview with David for the open position in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hhhh... okay. That is not funny. I am deducting sixty points from Voldemort for false pretenses. Okay, Dwight your turn. Wow us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The Aristocrats. A man and his wife and his children go into the offices of a talent agency. And the talent agent says, "Describe your act." And the man says something really, really raunchy and the talent representative says, "What do you call yourselves?" And the man says, "The Aristocrats!"

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [breathes deeply and runs across coals] Oooh, uh hah, ooh! Wha-hoo! Ahhhh...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [finishes story] I mean truly repulsive acts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a very, very funny story.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [runs over after walking over fire coals] Hey! I want to say something. I've been trying to be more honest lately and I just need to say a few things. I did the coal walk! Just, I did it! Michael, you couldn't even do that. Maybe I should be your boss? Wow, I feel really good right now. Why didn't any of you come to my art show? I invited all of you. That really sucked. It's like sometimes some of you act like I don't even exist. [turns and looks directly at Jim] Jim, I called off my wedding because of you. And now we're not even friends. And things are just like weird between us, and that sucks. And I miss you. You were my best friend before you went to Stamford, and I really miss you. I shouldn't have been with Roy. And there were a lot of reasons to call off my wedding. But the truth is, I didn't care about any of those reasons until I met you. And now you're with someone else. And that's... fine. It's... whatever. That's not what... I'm not... Okay, my feet really hurt. The thing that I'm just trying to say to you, Jim... and to everyone else in this circle I guess, is that I miss having fun with you. Just you, not everyone in the circle. Okay, I am going to go walk in the water now. Yeah. It's a good day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, that was amazing. But I am still looking for someone with a sales background.

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: Flintstones, meet the Flintstones. They're a modern stone-age family. Ba-ba-da-da-da. From the town of Bedrock, they're a page right out of history. Ba-da-da-da-da. [overlapping singing of the wrong verses] When you're with the Flintstones, have a yabba-dabba-doo time, a dabba-doo time, we'll have a gay old time!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: WWWWIIIILLLLMMMMAAAA!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nice!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So we have about an hour and a half. I suggest that you all go potty now and then we will be congregating on the party bus. Fun on wheels. Only way to travel. Besides a monorail.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, Bob was going to just drive me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No, no, no. No guests today. Classic gang only. Just us good friends, and Karen and Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sometimes Michael gets nostalgic and he talks about the classic gang. That's Michael, me, Jim, Dwight, Angela, Kevin, Oscar, Stanley, Phyllis, Creed, Meredith, Kelly and Ryan. We're a regular Ocean's Eleven.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, David Wallace is calling for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Hello. Hey, David. Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, you broke up with your boyfriend and then kept working together. How did that work out?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You remember you fired Roy for attacking Jim and I don't talk to him anymore really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Acrimonious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This way to the party bus. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [Sign says 'No Alcohol, No Loud Talking'] Um, What the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a bus that takes you to a party. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Um, I forgot my...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. Come on. Okay, everybody here?

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Then, Mr. Driver, we are off like a herd of turtles! Johnny Carson. [Meredith runs to catch up to bus with her large drink cup]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seat belts fastened, folks. Safety first. Hey what is all this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If I guess, will you tell me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that a sumo suit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know, we're putting on a play for Japanese investors.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we are not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please tell me. I've been so good...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are really annoying me. If you don't knock it off...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...I'm never gonna tell you anything ever again. Stop it! Stop it! Stop it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Can we please pull over at the next rest stop?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. We're only 10 minutes from the lake.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Pull over! Pull over! [Meredith uses a bush while all the other passengers look the other way, except Creed]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I am choosing my apprentice. Which is why I have modeled all my games after Survivor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Any questions?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The torches are lit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, for dramatic affect.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Michael, people are blindfolded. That's a hazard.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very good, Jim. Pam, please note that Jim is very astute. All right, are we ready?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you not gonna put out the torches?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Set!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think Jim would be a good boss. Plus he's eye candy. It's OK, Bob... Vance knows he's on my list. Um, George Clooney, Leonardo DiCaprio, Jim, and that British guy that got in trouble with a prostitute.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is an honor just to be considered for Michael's job. Honestly. And if I win it, then I will be ordering a pretty sizeable Most Improved Player plaque to put over the hole I punched in the wall.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Okay. Pam, who came out best in the race, in your opinion?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, Karen left her blindfold on the longest but she also threw her egg at Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because he wasn't following the rules.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think they were just having fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But they didn't complete their task, Pam! If people can't carry an egg in a spoon, blindfolded, then what does that tell you about how they will be able to manage a sales report, or conduct a business call?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It tells me nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly. Are you sure you're doing that right? Taking an awfully long time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: There's 800 of them!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's very important that you all try to eat as many hotdogs as you can...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hotdogs are really unhealthy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Son of a bitch. God! Okay. All right you know what? Here we go. On your mark! Get set!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Is there any mustard?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No mustard! No mustard! Just... eat it. Eat it, Phyllis. Dip it in the water so it will slide down your gullet more easily.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: That's what she said!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, not that-- just... come on, you guys, let's do it! I'm serious. Who's got the hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who's got the hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, Ryan...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan, I want to see you with a hot dog in your mouth. Right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Karen and I are having our own contest to see who can eat the most normal amount of tuna salad in an unspecified but very cofortable amount of time. I don't know what to tell you. Right now? Dead heat.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Keep eating tuna, Big Tuna. Loser!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's gonna throw up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Dwight and Stanley are in sumo suits] Ready! Go!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The guy who sits behind me and the guy who sits across from me are fighting to see who becomes my boss. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight knocks Stanley down] Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Eat sand, you fat, old man!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm out of it. Let's face it, the hot dog-eating contest was my best shot.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, since Andy isn't here, maybe I could be the team captain.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You? You haven't made a sale.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know, but I'd like to give this a try.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't try to flirt your way into this. Sometimes you really creep me out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in sumo suit, waves down a car, which swerves around him, runs after it, waving his arms] Wait! [throws sumo hair-hat at the retreating car]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard is in first place with four hot dogs! Dwight Schrute is a close second with three and a half! Here comes Stanley! Here comes Stanley, with three hot dogs!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is an inflatable sumo suit. [blows] Now, in the olden days, when they wanted to find a guy who could be king, they would have him pull a sword out of a stone. Well, times have changed. [blows] And it's not even about who is the best sumo wrestler. It's about who is the best boss. And I don't even care who wins. [blows] It's how they wrestle in a blow-up suit... [breathes in] that will tell me all I need to know [blows] or how sumo... [collapses]
